channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: world

item.title: Two new suspects handed preliminary charges in Louvre jewels heist case, Paris prosecutor says
item.description: PARIS (AP) — The Paris prosecutor said Saturday two new suspects were handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre museum, three days after they were arrested by police as part of the sweeping investigation.
item.dc:creator: SYLVIE CORBET, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Two new suspects handed preliminary charges in Louvre jewels heist case, Paris prosecutor says
item.description: The Paris prosecutor says two new suspects have been handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre museum.
item.dc:creator: Sylvie Corbet, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Aid efforts struggle to bring relief to parts of hurricane-stricken Jamaica
item.description: Rescuers and aid workers have spread across Jamaica to deliver food and water after Hurricane Melissa ravaged the island.
item.dc:creator: John Myers, Jr., Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Rubio, Vance see growing speculation over their 2028 ambitions
item.description: President Trump floating Vice President Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio as a potential presidential ticket is fueling questions about their working relationship and political futures as chatter about who will lead the 2028 Republican ticket intensifies.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, The Hill

item.title: Tanzanian President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: KAMPALA, Uganda (AP) — Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote, according to official results announced early Saturday. Her two main opponents had both been prevented from running, leaving her virtually unopposed.
item.dc:creator: RODNEY MUHUMUZA, Associated Press, PIX 11

item.title: Japan deploys military after record bear attacks across country
item.description: Bear attacks in Japan reach historic levels as poor harvests and shrinking hunter population create wildlife crisis in northern prefectures like Akita and Fukushima.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Ukraine says it hit a key fuel pipeline near Moscow that supplies Russian forces
item.description: Ukrainian forces have hit a crucial fuel pipeline in the Moscow region that supplies the Russian army, according to Ukraine's military intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Samya Kullab, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: Pakistan partially reopens Torkham border crossing to allow Afghan refugees to leave
item.description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan (AP) — Pakistan on Saturday partially reopened the Torkham border crossing with Afghanistan to allow thousands of stranded Afghan refugees to return home, officials said. Restrictions remain on all other cross-border movement, including trade.
item.dc:creator: RIAZ KHAN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Israel says the latest remains returned from Gaza are not bodies of hostages
item.description: Israel says the remains of three people Hamas handed over to the Red Cross do not belong to any hostages.
item.dc:creator: Renata Brito, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Top diplomats from Germany, Jordan and the UK call for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan war
item.description: Foreign ministers from Germany, Jordan and the United Kingdom have called for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan.
item.dc:creator: Jon Gambrell, Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: Protesters call for governor’s resignation after Rio’s deadliest police raid
item.description: RIO DE JANEIRO (AP) — Hundreds of protesters on Friday marched through one of the favelas targeted in Rio de Janeiro's most lethal police raid that left more than 100 dead, calling for Rio state Gov. Cláudio Castro to resign amid continued outrage over the deadly operation.
item.dc:creator: ELÉONORE HUGHES, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Israel's military prosecutor admits she leaked video of soldiers assaulting a Palestinian detainee
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israel’s top military prosecutor resigned Friday, admitting she was responsible for leaking a video showing soldiers assaulting a Palestinian detainee at a notorious military detention center, according to excerpts of the letter published by Israeli media.
item.dc:creator: JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Pakistan says it seeks no further escalation but urges Afghanistan to act against militants
item.description: ISLAMABAD (AP) — Pakistan does not seek further escalation of hostilities with Afghanistan but expects the South Asian country's Taliban rulers to address its security concerns by taking action against militants operating from Afghan soil, Pakistan’s Foreign Ministry said Friday.
item.dc:creator: MUNIR AHMED, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Prince Andrew moves to Sandringham
item.description: Unlike other properties that the royal family inhabits through the Crown Estate, Sandringham is privately owned by the king.
item.dc:creator: Teddy Grant, NewsNation

item.title: New inquest rules South African Nobel laureate Albert Luthuli was beaten to death in 1967
item.description: CAPE TOWN, South Africa (AP) — A new inquest into the 1967 death of South African Nobel Peace Prize winner and anti-apartheid leader Albert Luthuli has found that he was beaten to death, and it rejected a previous finding that he died as a result of being hit by a train.
item.dc:creator: GERALD IMRAY, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Built in the shadows and launched at night, Ukraine's long-range drones are rattling Russia
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — At a secret location in rural Ukraine, columns of attack drones are assembled at night and in near silence to strike deep inside Russia. Their targets are strategic: oil refineries, fuel depots, and military logistics hubs.
item.dc:creator: DEREK GATOPOULOS and VOLODYMYR YURCHUK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Louvre heist highlights thorny issue for museums: How to secure art without becoming fortresses
item.description: The day after the jewelry heist at the Louvre in Paris, officials from across Washington's world-famous museums were already talking, assessing and planning how to bolster their own security.
item.dc:creator: R.J. RICO and JOCELYN NOVECK, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Palestinian militants hand over remains of two more hostages to Red Cross in Gaza
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Hospital officials in Gaza say that Israel has handed over the bodies of 30 Palestinians.
item.dc:creator: JULIA FRANKEL and WAFAA SHURAFA, Associated Press, The Hill

item.title: China's Xi promises to protect free trade at APEC as Trump snubs major summit
item.description: Trump left the country a day earlier after reaching deals with Xi meant to ease their escalating trade war.
item.dc:creator: HYUNG-JIN KIM, KIM TONG-HYUNG and HUIZHONG WU, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Haiti, Jamaica and Cuba pick up the pieces after Melissa's destruction
item.description: SANTIAGO DE CUBA, Cuba (AP) — The rumble of large machinery, whine of chain saws and chopping of machetes echoed through communities across the northern Caribbean on Thursday as they dug out from the destruction of Hurricane Melissa and surveyed the damage left behind.
item.dc:creator: ARIEL FERNÁNDEZ, ANDREA RODRÍGUEZ and JOHN MYERS JR., Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Cruise ship allegedly leaves 80-year-old woman behind on island, daughter demands answers after death
item.description: Family demands coronial inquest after cruise ship allegedly abandons 80-year-old passenger on remote Australian island, leading to her death during luxury voyage.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Over 100 killed in Brazil’s deadliest police raid as Rio authorities battle drug gangs in favelas
item.description: Brazil’s deadliest police raid left 132 dead in Rio de Janeiro as officers clashed with gangs using drones and explosives in the city’s favelas.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Prince Andrew dragged out negotiations before banishment for cash: Source
item.description: Asked if there was a “number” Andrew had in mind, the source said, “I think a couple of million would go a long way.
item.dc:creator: Paula Froelich, NewsNation

item.title: Trump, Xi agree to ease trade war in high-stakes meeting
item.description: President Donald Trump announced an agreement with Chinese President Xi Jinping to ease their trade war following a meeting Thursday, with the U.S. scaling back tariffs and China delaying export controls and resuming some soybean purchases.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, WGN 9

item.title: Tariffs, trade and TikTok: Takeaways from Trump-Xi meeting
item.description: Trump said he and China’s Xi left the nearly two-hour meeting with newfound solidarity on a laundry list of issues.
item.dc:creator: Libbey Dean, NewsNation

item.title: 5 more arrests made in Louvre jewel heist
item.description: It took thieves less than eight minutes to steal the jewels valued at $102 million. The treasures remain missing.
item.dc:creator: ANGELA CHARLTON and THOMAS ADAMSON, Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: Trump cuts China tariff after Xi signals tougher fentanyl enforcement, rare-earth pause
item.description: Trump announced a cut on Chinese imports after meeting with Xi in South Korea, citing new understandings on fentanyl enforcement, farm trade and rare-earth exports.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Mexico worries its citizens might get blown up at sea by US
item.description: “We are not in agreement with these interventions, and we have a protocol that has yielded results,” Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum said.
item.dc:creator: Julian Resendiz, NewsNation

item.title: Putin says Russia's nuclear-armed underwater drone was tested successfully
item.description: MOSCOW (AP) — Russia has conducted a successful test of a new atomic-powered and nuclear-capable underwater drone, President Vladimir Putin said Wednesday, declaring that the new weapon can't be intercepted.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, NewsNation

item.title: South Korea, US advance talks of $350B trade deal
item.description: President Trump said a deal with South Korea was "pretty much finalized," though neither government has signed an official agreement.
item.dc:creator: Libbey Dean, NewsNation

item.title: Hamas victim memorial featuring Shiri Bibas and sons targeted by vandals in Milan, Italy
item.description: Artist AleXsandro Palombo calls the defacement of his Bibas family memorial mural in Milan an antisemitic act disguised as activism rather than legitimate protest.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump arrives in South Korea for key talks ahead of APEC summit, Xi meeting
item.description: Donald Trump visits Seoul for talks with President Lee Jae Myung focused on trade, investment, and maintaining stability amid growing tensions in the Asia-Pacific region.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Trump visits South Korea as he attempts to secure billions in investment
item.description: President Trump met South Korean leader Lee Jae Myung in Gyeongju, discussing partnerships during the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation summit.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Texas honeymooners trapped in Jamaica as Category 5 Hurricane Melissa slams island
item.description: Texas newlyweds Kasydee and Hunter Bishop are trapped near Montego Bay, Jamaica, as Hurricane Melissa approaches as a Category 5 storm with 175 mph winds.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Man accused of stabbing teens with fork on international flight
item.description: Praneeth Kumar Usiripalli, 28, was charged with assault with a dangerous weapon with intent to cause bodily harm on an aircraft.
item.dc:creator: Sean Noone, NewsNation

item.title: Gaza ceasefire tested as Israel and Hamas exchange fire and blame
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Israeli army launched a barrage of attacks in Gaza on Tuesday as tensions with Hamas grew two weeks into a fragile ceasefire, and the militant group responded by saying it would delay handing over the body of a hostage.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Ukraine's long-range strikes cut Russia's oil refining capacity by 20%, Zelenskyy says
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine’s long-range strikes on refineries inside Russia have reduced Moscow’s oil refining capacity by 20%, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, citing intelligence from Western governments.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, WGN 9
